titleInfo.title: 'File E/17 Kuwait Deputation to Riyadh. Death of Sh. Salim of Koweit'

physicalDescription.extent: This file is arranged approximately in chronological order.
Foliation: This file has a foliation number in the top right hand corner of the recto of each folio. The number is enclosed by a circle.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between British officials at Bahrain, Kuwait, Bushire and Baghdad.The papers within this file concern relations between Ibn Sa‘ūd and Kuwait following the events of 1920 when the forces of the Ikhwan Movement under the leadership of Fayṣal al-Dawīsh laid siege to the Red Fort (Qaṣr al-Aḥmar) at al-Jahrā’, Kuwait.Also included within the file are details concerning the death of Sheikh Sālim al-Mubārak Āl Ṣabāḥ of Kuwait in February 1921, and the succession of his son, Shaikh Aḥmad al-Jābir Āl Ṣabāḥ.
